revised_title: Biological Nitrogen Fixation in Upland and Marginal Areas of the UK
tldr: The article discusses the role of biological nitrogen fixation, particularly by white clover, in improving upland and marginal areas of agriculture in the UK. It highlights the importance of soil pH, nutrient levels, and microbial associations for successful establishment and maintenance of white clover in these areas. The author emphasizes the potential for increased agricultural productivity and reduced reliance on synthetic fertilizers through efficient nitrogen fixation.
